segment.source: Audit Audit the use of Backup and Restore privilege (Windows 10)
segment.target: Audit Audit the use of Backup and Restore privilege (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Audit Audit the use of Backup and Restore privilege security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Audit Audit the use of Backup and Restore privilege security policy setting.

segment.source: Audit: Audit the use of Backup and Restore privilege
segment.target: Audit: Audit the use of Backup and Restore privilege

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Audit: Audit the use of Backup and Restore privilege security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Audit: Audit the use of Backup and Restore privilege security policy setting.

segment.source: The Audit: Audit the use of Backup and Restore privilege policy setting determines whether to audit the use of all user rights, including Backup and Restore, when the Audit privilege use policy setting is configured.
segment.target: The Audit: Audit the use of Backup and Restore privilege policy setting determines whether to audit the use of all user rights, including Backup and Restore, when the Audit privilege use policy setting is configured.

segment.source: Enabling both policy settings generates an audit event for every file that is backed up or restored.
segment.target: Enabling both policy settings generates an audit event for every file that is backed up or restored.

segment.source: Set Audit: Audit the use of Backup and Restore privilege to Disabled.
segment.target: Set Audit: Audit the use of Backup and Restore privilege to Disabled.

segment.source: Enabling this policy setting can generate a large number of security events, which might cause servers to respond slowly and force the security event log to record numerous events of little significance.
segment.target: Enabling this policy setting can generate a large number of security events, which might cause servers to respond slowly and force the security event log to record numerous events of little significance.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: Changes to this policy become effective without a computer restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.
segment.target: Changes to this policy become effective without a computer restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.

segment.source: Enabling this policy setting in conjunction with the Audit privilege use policy setting records any instance of user rights that are being exercised in the security log.
segment.target: Enabling this policy setting in conjunction with the Audit privilege use policy setting records any instance of user rights that are being exercised in the security log.

segment.source: If Audit privilege use is enabled but Audit: Audit the use of Backup and Restore privilege is disabled, when users use backup or restore user rights, those events will not be audited.
segment.target: If Audit privilege use is enabled but Audit: Audit the use of Backup and Restore privilege is disabled, when users use backup or restore user rights, those events will not be audited.

segment.source: Enabling this policy setting when the Audit privilege use policy setting is also enabled generates an audit event for every file that is backed up or restored.
segment.target: Enabling this policy setting when the Audit privilege use policy setting is also enabled generates an audit event for every file that is backed up or restored.

segment.source: This can help you to track down an administrator who is accidentally or maliciously restoring data in an unauthorized manner.
segment.target: This can help you to track down an administrator who is accidentally or maliciously restoring data in an unauthorized manner.

segment.source: Alternately, you can use the advanced audit policy, Audit Sensitive Privilege Use, which can help you manage the number of events generated.
segment.target: Alternately, you can use the advanced audit policy, Audit Sensitive Privilege Use, which can help you manage the number of events generated.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: When the backup and restore function is used, it creates a copy of the file system that is identical to the target of the backup.
segment.target: When the backup and restore function is used, it creates a copy of the file system that is identical to the target of the backup.

segment.source: Making regular backup and restore volumes is an important part of your incident response plan.
segment.target: Making regular backup and restore volumes is an important part of your incident response plan.

segment.source: However, a malicious user could use a legitimate backup copy to gain access to information or to impersonate a legitimate network resource to compromise your enterprise.
segment.target: However, a malicious user could use a legitimate backup copy to gain access to information or to impersonate a legitimate network resource to compromise your enterprise.

segment.source: Enable the Audit: Audit the use of Backup and Restore privilege setting.
segment.target: Enable the Audit: Audit the use of Backup and Restore privilege setting.

segment.source: Alternatively, implement automatic log backup by configuring the AutoBackupLogFiles registry key.
segment.target: Alternatively, implement automatic log backup by configuring the AutoBackupLogFiles registry key.

segment.source: If you enable this option when the Audit privilege use setting is also enabled, an audit event is generated for every file that is backed up or restored.
segment.target: If you enable this option when the Audit privilege use setting is also enabled, an audit event is generated for every file that is backed up or restored.

segment.source: This information could help you to identify an account that was used to accidentally or maliciously restore data in an unauthorized manner.
segment.target: This information could help you to identify an account that was used to accidentally or maliciously restore data in an unauthorized manner.

segment.source: For more information about configuring this key, see Microsoft Knowledge Base article 100879.
segment.target: For more information about configuring this key, see Microsoft Knowledge Base article 100879.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, a large number of security events could be generated, which could cause servers to respond slowly and force the security event log to record numerous events of little significance.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, a large number of security events could be generated, which could cause servers to respond slowly and force the security event log to record numerous events of little significance.

segment.source: If you increase the security event log size to reduce the chances of a system shutdown, an excessively large log file may affect system performance.
segment.target: If you increase the security event log size to reduce the chances of a system shutdown, an excessively large log file may affect system performance.
